channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.
channel.prism:copyright: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Nonequilibrium chemical short-range order in metallic alloys
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 08 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64733-z

This study reveals that traditional manufacturing can create nonequilibrium short-range order in metallic alloys, offering an additional dimension for tailoring alloy properties beyond composition and microstructure.
item.dc:title: Nonequilibrium chemical short-range order in metallic alloys
item.dc:creator: Mahmudul Islam
Killian Sheriff
Yifan Cao
Rodrigo Freitas

item.title: Defect-engineered black tetragonal-tungsten-bronze ferroelectric crystal for full spectrum absorption and broadband photoelectronic conversion
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 08 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64507-7

The authors propose a hierarchical defect engineering strategy for ferroelectric oxides to achieve full-spectrum optical absorption and boost broadband self-powered photodetection, realizing self-powered photodetection in the 250–5000 nm range with a responsivity of >1 mA/W.
item.dc:title: Defect-engineered black tetragonal-tungsten-bronze ferroelectric crystal for full spectrum absorption and broadband photoelectronic conversion
item.dc:creator: Yaqian Wang
Ruirui Liu
Tian-Ci Ma
Yabo Wu
Dazhi Lu
Mao-Hua Zhang
Fei Liang
Haohai Yu
Huaijin Zhang
Yicheng Wu
